channel.title: Playstation 3 Vs. Xbox 360 Vs. Wii
channel.description:
[b]Firstly, I don't want this locked. Mainly because of me, the last one got locked because of flaming. Lets keep this argument as civilized as possible, without shouting random insults are eachother.
I'm going to try and be as un-biased as I possible can. [/b]
[b]The reason this isn't a poll, is because I don't want people voting, and then not backing up their vote. I want this to be a debate.[/b]
[b][u]PlayStation 3 (Non Technical)[/u][/b] [b][i]Pros[/i][/b]
[ul][li]Great graphics[/li] [li]30 games available on EU release[/li] [li]Sleek design[/li][/ul]
[b][i]Cons[/i][/b]
[ul][li]Expensive. $600 or £425[/li] [li]HDTV is needed to experience the full capabilities of the graphics[/li] [li]Sony decided to use SpyWare as a way of advertising :mad:[/li][/ul]
[i]Missing a pro/con? Let me know[/i]
[b][u]Xbox 360 (Non Technical)[/u][/b] [b][i]Pros[/i][/b]
[ul][li]Great Graphics[/li] [li]Relatively cheap[/li] [li]Halo 3[/li] [li]Computer games such as Battlefield 2142 have been converted to play on the 360 (Microsoft)[/li] [li]Xbox Live[/li] [li]Ability to be customized and modded[/li] [li]Two types available. Premium and Core[/li][/ul]
[b][i]Cons[/i][/b]
[ul][li]Can get slightly dependent on Live[/li] [li]Not many good titles out yet[/li] [li]Limited exclusives[/li] [li]Bad cooling system[/li] [li]Pay to play Live[/li] [li]Big difference between Core and Premium[/li][/ul]
[i]Missing a pro/con? Let me know[/i]
[b][u]Nintendo Wii (Non Technical)[/u][/b] [b][i]Pros[/i][/b]
[ul][li]GREAT fun[/li] [li]Cheap[/li] [li]Fun for all ages[/li] [li]Third party support coming soon[/li][/ul]
[b][i]Cons[/i][/b]
[ul][li]Not exactly for hardcore gamers[/li] [li]Lack of graphical power[/li] [li]Sensitive control can sometimes mess up a bit[/li] [li]Could be considered a novelty[/li] [li]Shortage of console[/li][/ul]
[i]Missing a pro/con? Let me know[/i]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[b][u]Playstation 3 (Technical)[/u][/b]
[ul][li]Comes in 20GB and 60GB Hard drives[/li] [li]3.2 GHz Cell Broadband Engine[/li] [li]Memory 256MB XDR Main RAM, 256MB GDDR3 VRAM[/li] [li]Wireless Controller (Motion sensitive too)[/li] [li]Blu-Ray player[/li] [li]GPU - NVIDIA-SCEI "RSX"[/li] [li]Media - BD-ROM DVD-ROM CD-ROM Super Audio CD[/li][/ul]
[b][i]Other[/i][/b]
[ul][li]Possibility to install operating systems on your Playstation[/li] [li]Firmware updates through the PS3[/li] [li]Compatible with the PSP. E.G - Can be used as a mirror in F1: Championship Edition[/li][/ul]
[i]Missing a something? Let me know[/i]
[b][u]Xbox 360 (Technical)[/u][/b]
[ul][li]3.2 GHz PPC Tri-Core Xenon[/li] [li]500 MHz ATI Xenos[/li] [li]20GB Hard drives/memory cards[/li] [li]Media - DVD CD Additional - HD DVD[/li] [li]Xbox Live - AMAZING. A lot of options and features. E.g [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xbox_Live_Marketplace]Marketplace[/url] [/li] [li]GUI - Xbox 360 Dashboard[/li][/ul]
[i]Missing a something? Let me know[/i]
[b][u]Nintendo Wii[/u][/b]
[ul][li]CPU - IBM PowerPC-based[/li] [li]GPU - ATI "Hollywood"[/li] [li]System Storage - 512 MB Internal flash memory Nintendo GameCube Memory Card Secure Digital card[/li] [li]Media - 12 cm Wii Optical Disc 8 cm Nintendo GameCube Game Disc[/li] [li]Connectivity - Wi-Fi Bluetooth USB 2.0 x2 LAN Adapter (via USB)[/li] [li]ADXL330 accelerometers in the Wii remote. Rotational orientation and translational acceleration[/li][/ul]
[i]Missing a something? Let me know[/i]
[b]Most of you, including myself don't know much about the above specifications. If you want to learn about the specifications, what they mean, and what's better, your best bet is to go to www.wikipedia.org[/b]
[u][b]Posting your opinion? Back your opinion up with an argument. Flaming/Spamming will be reported.[/b][/u]
Kai, lets go.

item.title: Playstation 3 Vs. Xbox 360 Vs. Wii
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:41, topic:69925”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=102734.msg2382894#msg2382894 date=1218644628]

Playstation 3 (Technical)
Comes in 20GB and 60GB Hard drives

Wrong. It comes in 20, 40, 60, and 80GB models. Specifically speaking in the US (but most likely a fact for most other countries as well), the 20GB and 60GB models are no longer built and shipped off to stores for shipping. The 60GB model is the best when it comes to backwards compatibility with PS2 games, but the only way to get one nowadays is to buy one off the net for more than the 80GB model. As the 40 and 80GB models are the only ones available in stores in the US (as far as I know), the 80GB model is usually picked (for a mere 100 USD or 67 EURO more) as that specific model can be considered a gaming device AND a media device. This is so because the 80GB model has three extra input slots for a memory stick, SD memory card, and CompactFlash (CF) card.

P.S. I didn’t notice the date of this topic until after I wrote that so I’m gonna leave it how it is.
[/quote]
please learn to look at post dates.[/quote]Please learn to realize there were half a dozen posts before mine and that I even commented on that point at the end of my post.

Read full topic

item.title: Playstation 3 Vs. Xbox 360 Vs. Wii
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:35, topic:69925”][quote author=exe626 link=topic=102734.msg2382275#msg2382275 date=1218611676]
tbh, PSN is shit. yeah, it’s free, but it’s shit. all it does is invite more spoiled kids, paying for XBL gives me some maturity, at least.
[/quote]
I would of agreed with you, a year ago. But now psn has had a good few updates which has brought the bar up to close behind xbox live and with all the planned updates it will soon be on par with xbox live.

As far as online in-game play, it is just as good, there are never any connection issues or anything like that if there is then its down to the game not playstation network.

Come to think of it though, there is not much setting xbox live and psn apart now as it is, as far as i can see anyway. As far as you saying xbox live is more mature then i’d have to disagree, i’m not saying either are more mature than the other but as the ps3 still has a higher price it usually is older players you find online.

Like i said though, a year ago psn was utter shit compared to xbox live, but now - and i’ll ask you to give me some things that makes xbox live better psn, i’ll name one though now, xbox live has a better sense of community compared to psn which is supposed to change with playstation home and such… we’ll see.[/quote]well, i’ve only played my ps3 a handful of times, since then all it does is sit on my stand, next to my xbox360 elite. even though the ps3 cost more, it doesn’t mean parents wouldn’t buy it for their spoiled children. the xbox360 has XBL, which cost a little extra, but connects you with millions, and kicks out all the kids who want to join for free. sure, we have kids like these: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9G143bHweAY, but i see a lot less of them outside of Halo.

Read full topic

As the 40 and 80GB models are the only ones available in stores in the US (as far as I know), the 80GB model is usually picked (for a mere 100 USD or 67 EURO more) as that specific model can be considered a gaming device AND a media device. Specifically speaking in the US (but most likely a fact for most other countries as well), the 20GB and 60GB models are no longer built and shipped off to stores for shipping. The 60GB model is the best when it comes to backwards compatibility with PS2 games, but the only way to get one nowadays is to buy one off the net for [i]more than the 80GB model.[/i] As the 40 and 80GB models are the only ones available in stores in the US (as far as I know), the 80GB model is usually picked (for a mere 100 USD or 67 EURO more) as that specific model can be considered a gaming device AND a media device. item.title: Playstation 3 Vs. Xbox 360 Vs. Wii
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

exe626:

tbh, PSN is shit. yeah, it’s free, but it’s shit. all it does is invite more spoiled kids, paying for XBL gives me some maturity, at least.

I would of agreed with you, a year ago. But now psn has had a good few updates which has brought the bar up to close behind xbox live and with all the planned updates it will soon be on par with xbox live.

As far as online in-game play, it is just as good, there are never any connection issues or anything like that if there is then its down to the game not playstation network.

Come to think of it though, there is not much setting xbox live and psn apart now as it is, as far as i can see anyway. As far as you saying xbox live is more mature then i’d have to disagree, i’m not saying either are more mature than the other but as the ps3 still has a higher price it usually is older players you find online.

Like i said though, a year ago psn was utter shit compared to xbox live, but now - and i’ll ask you to give me some things that makes xbox live better psn, i’ll name one though now, xbox live has a better sense of community compared to psn which is supposed to change with playstation home and such… we’ll see.

Read full topic

item.title: Playstation 3 Vs. Xbox 360 Vs. Wii
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Flamemanethedemonic, post:26, topic:69925”]PLUS
When you said ‘Pay to play Live’ on the XBox 360, you forgot to say, (though everyone knows) that PSN is free! That should be under the Pros.

(PS Someone might have said this already but I’m too lazy to read all of these posts.[/quote]
Xbox 360 online = extreme quality and satisfying game play + service. What you get for Xbox Live is totally worth the price.

Whereas I’ve heard many complaints about the PS3’s online service being incomparable to the 360’s.
I’m not all for these debate topics. Different people have different tastes, there is no perfect console, just let people get what they want.

And, i agree with Lothy. I hardly notice any different in graphics. It’s just how the game is designed, too; they might have not payed attention to major details.

But, for me, Xbox 360. Get new remotes, playstation. (N)

Read full topic

item.title: Playstation 3 Vs. Xbox 360 Vs. Wii
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“kmb, post:18, topic:69925”][quote author=lothy link=topic=102734.msg1044419#msg1044419 date=1174749349]
I’ll go for the Xbox 360, again.

There’s little if any noticeable difference in the graphics. That’s almost as bad as someone saying that you should have songs with a higher bitrate, even though you can’t hear the difference.

Secondly, the original Xbox was home to several games that I enjoyed a lot - Fable, the original Halo, and so on.
I’ve always enjoyed the game play I get from Xbox games.

On another note, the Xbox 360 is sleek too.

[/quote]
Offtopic, but that’s bullshit. I can definitely hear the difference between a 96 kbps song and a 320 kb/s song, even with my headphones.

Get a better audio system =P. It’s like saying “don’t buy a flat screen monitor, because it’s no better than a non-flat.” You shouldn’t make assumptions only because you can’t see/hear the difference.

Ontopic: My friend just got his ps3, I’ll rate it soon after playing a bit.[/quote]
I was thinking more 192kbps vs 320kbps. Personally, I don’t really hear the difference. Maybe I’m going deaf at 17.

Read full topic

item.title: Playstation 3 Vs. Xbox 360 Vs. Wii
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

[quote=“fr33sc4p3, post:1, topic:70507”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=102734.msg1044568#msg1044568 date=1174754854]

Hmm… Looking at the above post-and seeing as you, Mr.Chris don’t have a ps3 yet but defending it with your life;
The graphics of the Xbox360 are easily seen, great-clear, on any television.
On the ps3, you req. HD television to see something similar to 360’s graphics.
Besides, they stoped production of the ps3 because of too many bugs and flaws.
Mis well get it as soon as you can, in about 6 months-1year, its gonna be worth alot.
The blue light thing in ps3 is the only real feature I like about it, it provides a great picture when I watch movies with it. But thats the only real thing I like about it.

Erm, before you post here, can you actually find out what your talking about? Also, learn to layout your paragraphs properly.

Secondly, what are you talking about? You do not need a HDTV to match the Xbox graphics. Also, just because I don’t have one, doesn’t mean I haven’t played it.

The blue light thing? You mean blu-ray. I’m not even replying to the rest of that post.
[/quote]
Acaully i find the Graphics better even when i tried it on a pc monitor… Ps3 has 3x better graphics its 2x more powerfull

Like i said i do have both and am always comparing them but ps3 stays the best and stays my favourite[/quote]
You have broken eyes.
